content:
the argument is ever put quite like this, but I believe this is the ar-
gument used nevertheless. There may however be a certain confusion be-
tween  “rules  of  conduct”  and  “laws  of  behavior”  to  cloud  the  issue.  By
“rules of conduct” I mean precepts such as “Stop if you see red lights,” on
which one can act, and of which one can be conscious. By “laws of behav-
ior” I mean laws of nature as applied to a man’s body such as “if you pinch
him he will squeak.” If we substitute “laws of be
